title: Help I cant reinstall American LOL after I came back from Korea C++ error
body: So during summer break I went to Korea and downloaded the korean server during my stay there. But when I uninstalled it and tried to reinstall the North American server it wouldn't work. First a "Command line option syntax error. type command / for help" thing would pop out then a "Visual c++ 2005 sp1 redistributable x64 mandatory prerequisite was not correctly installed" would pop out. I tried everything, looked up ways I could solve this issue but nothing is working. I think I even tried to download the c++ 2005 thing but there was a error for that too. I'm stuck and would really appreciate some help.

replies.body:
This typically happens if there are a few different issues going on. I suggest first updating Windows to ensure your OS is completely up to date. Next, uninstall any existing versions of C++ 2005 on your PC before installing a fresh copy from [this link.](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=3387)

Let me know if this helped.

I updated everything in my windows though there was one thing (graphic adapter?) that wouldn't update. I uninstalled all existing C++ 2005 and tried to install your link but a syntax error popped out and wouldn't let me install it. The error that popped out when I try to install league was (x64) not (x86)....I tried to install both, and one without the other but nothing works. (x86 wouldn't install at all). 
When I checked my programs there were C++ 2008 and 2012 both (x64) and (x86) versions existing. I didn't want to touch them just in case my other programs use them, but could they be the problem?

Not being able to install the graphics driver and C++ package is definitely not good. It could mean there are corrupt or missing files in your Windows installation and you may need to run a repair or complete reinstallation of Windows. As a last-ditch effort, I recommend performing a clean boot, then try running that C++ installation as admin by right-clicking on the executable and selecting *run as administrator*.

I hope this worked for you.

I tried the clean boot and run as administrator and unfortunately it didn't work.
Just in case I searched 'riot' in my computer and tried to delete whatever was left but there were a couple of files that wouldn't delete. Could they be the corrupt files? Though they aren't windows installation....
Also, I tried to download the korean server and for some reason it worked? Why would the korean server work but not North American?
Thank you for trying to help me!

I recommend we escalate this to our tech team so we can take a closer look at what's going on. You can run a set of system logs using our [**HRT App**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attach them to a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so we can get back to you.

Let me know if you have any questions.
